What are Ridgeview students thankful for?
While elearning is a new adventure for our school, the staff at Ridgeview is continually thankful for the families and students we serve. For homework, students were asked to reflect on elearning and look for the good in our new situation. We have compiled all of their answers into wordart. If you are not familiar with wordart, we enter all of the answers submitted by students and the bigger the word, the more it was submitted. Think it is pretty clear that YOU, the family and support systems of our kids are the most important things right now! Even in their own words! As a school we want to encourage you as parents--not to be perfect--but be present for your kids right now. Ridgeview is thankful for all you have done and are continuing to do! Please know we are here to support you and your student in any way!

4TH GRADE SCIENCE WAS EYE-OPENING

Miss Bales 4th grade science class tested a working model of the eye. They each cut and folded an eye and slid a cornea lens (a magnifying glass) into a paper retina. Then went to the glass hallway to allow sunlight to reflect through the lens and onto the retina. They discovered that it reflected an upside down image ranging from blurry to sharp. They will continue discussing and researching the eye to figure out why the image was upside down and what makes our own eyes see the world differently (blurry or sharply).
